The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, red berries as fruit. Hedyotis chrysotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
